intro: Tragacantha glareosa, commonly known as the Persian gum tree, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and woody pods. The plant is known for producing a resin that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a food additive. Its growth habit includes a tall, slender trunk with a crown of small, alternate leaves. Tragacantha glareosa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
